DOC.brief_summary: Dabigatran represent a new class of promising anticoagulation agents. As an oral direct thrombin inhibitor it has been effective in preventing venous thromboembolism in patients undergoing elective orthopaedic surgery. This ex vivo study is undertaken to investigate the ex-vivo effects of PradaxaÂ® on different coagulation parameters.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Dabigatran on Coagulation parameters-an ex Vivo Study
DOC.detailed_description: This mono-centric, open-label study is undertaken to validate the effects of Dabigatran on coagulation parameters in plasma samples of 70 patients after hip or knee replacement surgery treated with Dabigatran 150-220 mg/d. Plasma samples are obtained by blood collection before, after 2 hours and after 12-14 hours after Dabigatran dosing in steady state (on 3rd - 5th day).
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 y Hemorrhagic disorder Liver disease Anemia Severe renal impairment
